Key Arguments: The legislation grants excessive power to the government to silence dissenting opinions.
The bill is seen as a threat to free speech and democracy.
There is a lack of trust in government and mainstream media due to past misinformation during the pandemic.
The bill could lead to censorship of credible scientific experts and dissenting voices.
The legislation is perceived as a tool for government overreach and control over public discourse.
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill is a shameful piece of legislation that would give any Australian Government the power to silence, discredit, chill, deplatform, delete, censor and remove the content and credibility of anyone with a differing or inconvenient opinion.
This Bill is just another piece of legislation designed to erode our ability to hold Governments to account.
I have zero trust in the Government and its appointed agencies deciding truth for me.

This Bill is an attack on democracy, our basic human rights, our constitution, our freedom of speech and our ability to hold Governments and governance systems to account through ushering in 'lawful censorship'.
